title: Change Basic WPF sample project to SDK-style and multitarget to .net6
body:
**Description of Change**

This sample wasn't up to date with anyone working with .Net Core 3 or later.
I had to change it in the [samples repo](https://github.com/mattleibow/skiasharp-samples), but seems it was copied from this repo.

Preserving the 4.7.2 and adding .net 6 target.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I need to reorganise the samples folder.

This WPF sample is specially for the classic old projects. There should be a WPF sample with net core in the samples/Basic/NetCore/WPF folder.

comments.author: virzak
comments.body:
Not sure why you'd want to maintain the old verbose style, since this sample covers the Framework as well and the project file isn't the central aspect of the demo.

Also if you have WPF and WPF-NetCore folder, it could cause confusion in the future because the "core" branding was dropped with .net 5. If anything I'd say it should be WPF-.NetFramework and WPF.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I have to maintain both because I need to support both. The samples are also used as part of CI to test SkiaSharp.

The classic and sdk style are totally different package handling.
